alert.note: Alert for Big Stone (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:23AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Little Minnesota River near Peever affecting Roberts County. Minnesota River near Big Stone Lake affecting Roberts, Grant and Big Stone Counties. Minnesota River at Ortonville affecting Big Stone County. North Fork Whetstone River near Milbank affecting Grant County. West Branch 12 Mile Creek At Dumont affecting Traverse County. 5 Mile Creek Near Herman affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River Big Stone Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 971.6 feet, Water reaches shoreline homes on Shady Oak Drive. At 973.0 feet, 40 TO 60 structures inundated, including homes on the Ortonville peninsula. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 972.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM CDT Friday was 972.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 973.8 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 971.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening by 630 PM CDT.
